text: after unarmed black teenager Michael
Brown was shot and killed by a white
police officer in Ferguson Missouri in
2014 an uproar ensued and triggered a
national debate about police tactics
since then many police departments have
reexamined their use of force policies
but few have gone as far as the police
in Camden New Jersey one of the poorest
and most violent cities in America their
officers are relying on patience and
restraint to resolve tense encounters
that could quickly escalate Americans
have seen a lot of videos that show
police officers using deadly force but
the Camden police feel the following
three Clips show what police reform
looks like out in the field the scene is
a wrestler a man pulls out a knife and
threatens a customer before walking out
[Music]
when the police show up the man is still
swinging the knife and will not drop it
in the past incidents like this may have
resulted in officers firing on a suspect
because they consider themselves to be
at risk but something different happens
the officers continue to implore the man
to put down the knife but they hold
their fire eventually over 10 officers
are following the suspect they Corral
him down the street cleaning out traffic
ahead still they hold their fire
officers are now being trained to seek
alternatives other than shooting people
were armed with knives and acting
dangerously
when they get their chance they spring
into action apprehending him in another
video where man is refusing to let
officers arrest him the officers give
him the choice this situation could have
easily ended with officers tackling him
or shooting him with a Taser
but after patiently talking with him the
officers are able to make an arrest
calmly and without incident an
interaction after interaction police are
encouraged to exercise patience in calm
a situation rather than escalated here
police encourage a suicidal woman
holding a knife to drop it you can
clearly see that the officer is both
hands out he's not heard any gun or a
Taser so put the knife down Lisa in the
end they convince her to drop the knife
and even to kick it away even though the
footage in these videos may not seem
dramatic these videos are unusual there
are a few examples of policing videos in
the public eye that show tense
encounters resolving peacefully and
calmly but the hope is that that way of
operating will become increasingly more
common nationwide
